result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J Meng

defendant.name: Meng, Joseph J
defendant.address: N5583 Range Line Road, Tony, WI 54563

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph J Meng in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF90, 14CF100, 15CF115, 15CF53, 15CT21, along with uncharges case.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court satisfied will accept waiver.  DE will enter plea's to the following cases.  
14CF74-Ct 1, NC plea, court will note but hold in abeyance for a two year period.  Must complete all conditions laid out in the DAGP. Bond continues
14CF90-Ct 2, NC plea, court will accept and find the DE guilty.
14CF100-Ct 1, NC plea, Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  
14CF115-Ct 1, NC plea, court will note but hold in abeyance for a two year period.  Must complete all conditions laid out in the DAGP. Bond continues

15CT21, 15CF53, uncharged case and additional counts in above case will be DRI.  
Mr Meng addresses the court.  The court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will withhold sentence, 2 years probation, will serve 15 days jail on each count, consecutive, pay CC in both cases.  Will maintain sobriety, no bars, taverns or liquor stores,  jail will be served at the discretion of the DOC officer.  Court costs will be taken from the bond posted.  Any additional will be returned to poster.  DE's truck will be released to his father.  Will report to probation today.
and Order for Substitution of Attorney (filed in 14CF74)

Defendant Joseph J Meng in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF74, 14CF90, 14CF100, 14CF115, 15CT21.  Agreement was reached in these matters, but new charges may be pending.  Atty Nussberger addresses the court as to bond money posted, indicated DE will be going to LE Phillips for an assessment.  Once DE provides proof that he is enrolled the court will address reducing the bond.
DEFENDANTS TRUCK WILL REMAIN IN THE POSSESSION OF THE LPD UNTIL ALL CASES ARE RESOLVED.  DEFENDANT WILL TURN IN ALL KEYS. DO NOT OPERATE ANY MOTORIZED VEHICLES WITHOUT A VALID OPERATING PRIVILEGES.
